0.title: Introduction
0.summary: Natural Coin is a new philosophy of money built on circulation, decay, and resonance. It aims to prevent monopoly, reduce hoarding, and reward invisible contributions such as care, education, and environmental stewardship.

1.title: Chapter 1｜Core Definitions: Human・Currency・Nature
1.summary: Defines the triad relationship between Human, Currency, and Nature as the philosophical foundation of Natural Coin.

2.title: Chapter 2｜Introduction to Natural Coin: Flow and Decay
2.summary: Introduces Natural Coin as a system based on flow, decay, and resonance, contrasting with traditional capital logic.

3.title: Chapter 3｜Blind Spots of Capitalism: Monopoly, Hoarding, Invisible Value
3.summary: Exposes capitalism’s blind spots: monopolies, hoarding, and undervaluation of invisible social contributions.

4.title: Chapter 4｜Circulationism: The New Poetics of Economy
4.summary: Presents Circulationism as a new economic poetics that emphasizes movement, regeneration, and reciprocity.

5.title: Chapter 5｜Comparison with Capitalism, Welfare, Socialism
5.summary: Compares Natural Coin’s framework with capitalism, welfare states, and socialism to highlight its complementarity.

6.title: Chapter 6｜Seven Iron Rules of Natural Coin
6.summary: Outlines the Seven Iron Rules of Natural Coin that define its core governance principles.

7.title: Chapter 7｜Declaration and Belief Clauses
7.summary: Establishes a declaration and belief clauses that frame Natural Coin as both a system and philosophy.

8.title: Chapter 8｜Decay and Anti-Monopoly Mechanisms
8.summary: Explains decay and anti-monopoly mechanisms that prevent over-concentration of assets.

9.title: Chapter 9｜FreshDecay: Logic of Time-based Corruption
9.summary: Introduces FreshDecay, the principle of time-based currency corruption that enforces circulation.

10.title: Chapter 10｜Disval + Fresh Model Integration
10.summary: Shows the integration of Disval and Fresh models, combining anti-monopoly and anti-hoarding rules.

11.title: Chapter 11｜Currency and Time: The Fourth Dimension
11.summary: Reinterprets currency as a temporal medium, binding value with the fourth dimension of time.
